column1: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!////Great spot for tapas! You'd think that small dishes aren't filling
column2: but you get 2-3 and it becomes a full meal! I had the Wagyu Beef Carpacchio (truffle and oil overpowered the meat a bit)
column4: and chorizo wrapped dates (probably the best I've had- the salty and sweet balance out quite well). I also had the red sangria which ended up getting watered down as my ice melted (but I think that's more my fault). I checked into Yelp to get the free dessert tapas
column6: but small enough portion where it's not too overwhelming). All in all
column7: everything was delicious for a good price!
